comments:
This does nothing on my PC.  No dialog popup, no error message in the logs.  
Same problem whether it's a class, attribute or method.

we have never seen such a problem
can you try invoking it from the editor? (select an identifier and choose 
refactor/rename)
pls reopen the bug with a reproducable test case

Hi,

Eclipse 2.1 build id: 200303272130 on Windows 2000
I have a similar problem. Maybe the following steps helps reproducing the 
problem (it worked for me):
- import the jdt.ui plugin as a source plugin
- make a jar from it (jdt.jar) using the plugin-generated build.xml file
- exit Eclipse
- replace the original jar with the new one
- after the next start I cannot do rename actions
More interestingly, if I start a runtime workbench using the imported plugin, a 
rename action produces an IllegalAccessError (but only in the runtime 
workbench, using the same classes in main eclipse there is no error in log). 
The .log file:

Csaba

Following the thread on eclipse.tools.jdt I tried to set the 'Generated .class 
file compatibility' to 1.1. In this case everything seems OK, I can rename in 
the runtime workbench. After setting it back to 1.3, the above error occured 
again.

Csaba

Looks like this bug is a duplicate of bug 37846. I also use jdk1.4.1 to run 
eclipse.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 37846 ***
